title: Zoe
body:
Honestly im big on lore and i've been looking on a bunch of zoe threads and people dont seem to like the fact that she looks the way she looks or that the aspect of twilight chose a child, but isn't that what makes her so unique? Like aspects are these powerful entitys who entrust people to be gifted an immense amount of power(unless its pantheon and then that aspect is just a bitch) , so far we have the backstorys of the other aspects but people are kind of jumping to the whole she's a child or she looks unrealistic(even though league is the furthest thing from realistic). I think people are forgetting that in the case such as Taric even AFTER the process of climbing targon, the aspect of the mountain still looked into his soul to determine if he was truly worthy right? Despite the whole absurd amount of aspects within this time period. Twilight is defined as the "soft glowing light from the sky when the sun is right below the horizon" and taking into mind of that definition, it makes you think of being on the brink of waking up and just overall gives you a comfortable safe warm vibe. People seem to think twilight has something to do with stars and thats more of aurelion's specialty but, point of my ramblings is that Zoe was probably chosen because an ideal child perfectly embodies the feeling of twilight(even though children are monsters irl) Innocence, whimsical, bright, comforting, and the border between night and daytime/sun and moon. I think it was a genius idea to create a child aspect, give the people of runeterra some joy and truly emobdy the wonder of twilight! Besides its not as if we dont have three other grown ass serious aspects. Thanks for stopping to read my ramblings, just my thoughts!

Also (Star Guardian Zoe im calling it now)

replies.body:
All the aspects are bitches.  Pantheon is just the biggest bitch of the lot.

But, anyway, I think the problem that some people are having is that, at present, Zoe doesn't really fit the tone of the Targon lore thus fare provided.  Leona was rewritten to go through a whole murder zealot phase. All the aspects became complicit in the enslavement and betrayal of their friend, Sol.  Diana is still a murderer.  And Taric, who is the good one, still had to go through the backstory of being a complete and utter incompetent as a military leader, and was exiled from his home.

They all have this theme that plays on the old Greek Tragedies, in one way or another.  

Then, there's this girl who looks like she jumped out of a cartoon and sounds like she's about to start singing a song out of High School Musical or something.  She doesn't quite fit the tone that the other champions seem to be pushing toward.

However, this doesn't mean she doesn't fit the story.  As of now, the Space Targonians have no personality, no clear motivation, no understandable criteria for how they pick Aspects, and no actual explanation to how their powers work.  So Riot can do whatever they want, and it will make as much sense for the Targon story as anything else.  It just means that the Greek Tragedy theme is no longer prevalent, it may never have even been intentional.  That's really it.

> [{quoted}](name=Warlord Dienekes,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=5w2ZQFAN,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-11-04T05:00:19.098+0000)
>
> All the aspects are bitches.  Pantheon is just the biggest bitch of the lot.


What about the protector?
He sees Taric,who is one of the nicest champs in the game as his perfect host and doesn't interfere with his actions.

They’re powerful space mages that conquered an empire and have monsters on retainer. 

If they weren’t bitches they’d do their dirty work themselves instead of getting lower life forms to endanger their lives for them. 

That and they enslaved Sol and made him kill his friends for their needless expansion. 

The whole race are just a bunch of bitches.

Though I will concede, Protector is the least bitchy.

We don't know how their magic works.
Maybe they can only travel to other planets via posession?

Heck for all we know,they could be spirits who might need physical bodies to be able to interact with the physical realm at all.
Then they have no business getting involved in other people’s shit and conquering a space empire based on their slaves.

Considering that the void seems to be one of their big enemies,it is actually possible that it is only thanks to the targonians that runeterra wasn't consumed by it already.

Also so far there is nothing that indicates that anyone got their body taken against their will.
Even Atreus who was completely overtaken went to Mt.Targon himself and might have given his body willingly.

Yes, while under the mistaken belief they were giving their body to actual gods, not a bunch of space parasites. 

If they actually want to get people to combat the Void here’s how you do it: possess maybe 1 person and instead of wasting time and resources fighting each other and arguing over their clearly fictional religion, say:

Yo, guys, the Void is attacking. It sucks, they’re super evil. Here’s how you beat it. Oh, also, there’s a place called Piltover with magic weapons. Maybe go there. And get magic weapons.

Overall you are making a lot of assumptions here,which is understandable,since we really don't know that much about the targonians.

However we don't know if those who are completely overtaken are fooled in some way,as we have no idea what happened to atreus after he reached the peak and was accepted as the new host of the war.
And Diana,Leona and Taric accepted the fusion with their aspects on their own.

Also we don't know how much they know about the current state of runeterra,they might not have visited the planet in eons,so its possible they have no idea that piltover even exists.
And even if they do know about piltover,there is nothing that says that piltover would be willing to cooperate or that said weapons would really matter that much(if there is really something as powerful as aurelion sol on the other side of the void,then no amount of piltover weapons would make a difference).

Also the aspects don't seem to actually care that much about the religious conflict.After Leona fused with her aspect she went from "I wanna avenge the elders and kill Diana" to "Oh I should talk to her",so it is entirely possible that the lunari/solari-conflict was caused by the humans,not the aspects.(and even if it was caused by the aspects,we don't know what started it,there could have been a valid reason for this conflict)

If there is an evil ASol then there is nothing a guy who can fight really well and maybe move like a comit on occasion can do anyway. Sol makes everything we’ve seen an Aspect do utterly pointless by comparison. 

If they haven’t visited in eons (seems unlikely since people have stories about Aspects appearing at separate times, meaning the legends have to be early enough to not have been meshed together as happens with actually old legends). Then they have no purpose being on the planet anyway. Get out and let people be people. By the very least, if that is true, they are incompetent strategists. Always learn about the terrain of where you’re going to be fighting. That’s literally in one of the earlier chapters of Sun Tzu. 

Leona and Diana were legitimate believers in the divinity of the Targonians before their fusions. Hell they were only set on their current path because of their religious beliefs that we know are inherently wrong. 

The Aspects do actually seem to care a bit, because of how Diana post transformation goes right back to change the religious beliefs of the Solari to include worship of the moon.  Not to say “Hey it’s all a lie made by some aliens. Ones literally inside me now, here, they have the power to create visions and enslave space dragons, I’m sure they can just convince a bunch of old people.”

Now, sure. The Aspects are so vague and their magic is mostly bullshit to make the plot move. Maybe once Riot explains them it will all work out. But that’s still bullshit, making a strange incoherent setting to justify the Aspects behaving like bitches, instead of just having a story where they aren’t gaping assholes.

In the end we really don't know enough about the aspects to really get a clear picture here.

We don't know what they want,we don't know what their internal conflict(or conflicts?) look like,we don't know what else they are doing in the galaxy,we don't know if they trick people so that they can snatch their bodies or if the other person is well informed about this.
Heck we don't even know if the current aspects all work for the targonian empire or if some of them are just doing their own thing...

Here’s the thing that makes this a problem. 

There are a lot of balls in the air here about the Space Targonians. Many of them are actually kind of contradictory. This means they’re going to have to leave it vague, and have the mystery itself be the point. Which is a terrible idea when it is so tied to very physical champions identities and the fate of the world.

Or, it will have to be explained in a way that successfully answers every question and tangentially makes it so the path they chose (to infest normal people) was actually the smartest decision available to them. When done this has the potential to not hit that mark and it makes everyone involved look all the dumber. Or it feels completely contrived that it’s set up exactly that specific way that allows them to infest some people and grant visions but not just tell everyone on the mountain what to do, and a host of other problems. 

I have never read one that actually succeeded at being a satisfying answer. The big attempts of recent years: Lost, Battlestar Galactica failed pretty spectacularly that it left everyone actually interested in the mystery and not the soap opera of the characters feel cheated. 

In the end, if we find out the extent of the Aspects power and I go “With that I could make a better plan to solve their problems during a bath!” Then Riot will have failed.

I don't mind her craziness as much as the realism of her facial features compared to some other recent human champions. It's a very strong contrast that makes me wonder what her splash will look like.
This. I totally forgot to look at it from the other aspects perspectives smh. Shit is dark. Thanks for the insight man.

Things to think about:   

Zoe is at the _end_ of childhood.

Solar reflect the sun.  Lunar reflect the moon.

Also ragnarok is an interesting word.

hmmm.....     


(Also I love cookies)

Between the dawn and dusk.

So would Leona and Diana fight over who gets custody?

Wait, so I just looked into the mythology about ragnarok;

wikipedia:
In Norse mythology, Ragnarök is a series of future events, including a great battle, foretold to ultimately result in the death of a number of major figures (including the gods Odin, Thor, Týr, Freyr, Heimdallr, and Loki), the occurrence of various natural disasters, and the subsequent submersion of the world in water. Afterward, the world will resurface anew and fertile, the surviving and returning gods will meet, and the world will be repopulated by two human survivors.

In Norse mythology, Líf (identical with the Old Norse feminine noun meaning "life, the life of the body") and Lífþrasir (Old Norse masculine name from líf and þrasir. Lexicon Poëticum defines this name as "Livæ amator, vitæ amans, vitæ cupidus", "Líf's lover, lover of life, zest for life"), sometimes anglicized as Lif and Lifthrasir—female and male respectively—are two humans who are foretold to survive the events of Ragnarök by hiding in a wood called Hoddmímis holt, and after the flames have abated, to repopulate the newly risen and fertile world.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Ragnarok is the event that kills a lot of gods in Norse mythology (and night can be used as an analogy in literature for death). The two survivors, Líf and Lífþrasir, repopulating the world would bring about a new age of life (and dawn can be used as an analogy of life in literature). 

Zoe is the aspect of _TWILIGHT_ (which twilight can be the time between night and dawn). Zoe is also "at the _end_ of childhood", which for females could be a twilight between youth and motherhood.

Does this mean that Zoe is Líf, and her purpose as an aspect is to survive some impending ragnarok event in Runeterra so she can repopulate it? Also, does this mean that there will be another champion that will come out at some point that is a male Lífþrasir, and is in love with Zoe?

In general I hope that we'll get some insight into the aspects with her.
For most champs the whole "aspect"-thing seems more like an sidenote,it doesn't really feel like {{champion:44}} {{champion:131}} or {{champion:89}} share their bodies with another entity(I mean at least in {{champion:80}}s case it is kinda justified)
